comments.commentBody: HI, Luis again, Also is important to mention those institutions that helps people with low incomes in this new generations to study when they don't have enough income and for that reason they don't goes to the High School or don't enroll for the University, it is a great hope in middle of so much difficulty, we need more of this institutions in everywhere, as well as Institutions that offer us facilities and free of charge ways to study . The message is: always there is someone, always there is something to do, always there is a hope, always there is an opportunity,  ourselves  have the key to transform our way and the most important thing God always is there ready to help us if we look for Him.
no confirmation needed cabinet members are appointed .

Our failed state started in 2008. One can't alienate half our population and get away with it.

Perhaps Trump will do better.

Hope and change please.

Chris,
That has been my thought all along. The republicans want him gone as well and I am just curious how fast they are going to do this.
So the fomenter of Division now wants to be the Uniter, Good Luck Pal. Obama tried from day one to be a Uniter. Have the Democrats learned anything?

Hillary won the popular vote. And, believe me, there is no mandate for Trump's perverse stupid agenda and for America to be governed by his bottom feeding cohorts. He won't make it through the first  year without wearing hand cuffs.

GWB claimed it and made it stick when he lost the popular vote, and probably lost the electoral vote too, if Florida had been allowed to carry out its legally mandated recount.  It wasn't right then, and isn't right now, but that particular lie seems to have sticking power.  In the current case, the media is making his case for him.
You don't understand Republicanese, magicisnotreal. If they say it's a mandate, that's enough for the dolts. It's a mandate!!

I keep seeing references to the GOP claiming a mandate. The term "mandate- authority to act" as applied to an election is meant to be used when the victor has won by a huge sweeping margin. Something well over 50% not as is the case today when the victor has not even gotten 50% and is several hundred thousand votes behind his opponent.
He won there is no "Mandate" just a normal electoral win and an important job to do.

You're right. And NO! --- not singing 'Kumbaya' with Trump.
Not now.
Not ever.

Pence is a minor monster. At least Trimp lied when he passed himself off and promoted religion and guns and hatred of gays and, welI we know he really does hate women so that one is in his column

Pence will never throw off the shroud of deplorable hating because in him it's real.

Assange is not in America. He is under house arrest in the Ecuadorean embassy in England. Comey already has a job, and I am sure he would love to avoid further spotlight.

Christie should get the special post of hiring local street police officers in Wyoming or something.
Giuliani can go on CNN, MSNBC, etc. and speak full time for Trump
Gingrich can be posted as the new Ambassador to Libya...since has been obsessed with Benghazi. Whatever you get obsessed with you get to fix under Trump's administration.

Trump needs to avoid talkative arrogant White men, or old farts, in his administration like a plague. Otherwise he'll be out of office very quickly.

The Donald needs smart doers from all corners of the society.
And Putin, although I'm sure he's already listening in on every word right now.
What about Putin?

Christie, Giuliani, and Gingrich?

I would think the first cabinet positions should go to Assange and Comey.

It is not official about Gingrich, Giuliani or Christie.  It is speculation because they were called onto the stage.  If we have learned anything this past year it is not to trust media speculation, and that, unfortunately, includes the NY Times.  Wait and see.  Trump maybe more intelligent than you think.  At any rate I devoutly hope so.
Wow, "jodee," with such spiteful comments, you would fit right in here in the good ol' U.S.A. Sure you're not one of us? Your words and tone are so very American.

The fact that you throw darts at the USA and do not proclaim what perfect, nirvana of a country you are lobbing them from says volumes about you.

It's clear that you and Trump share something in common, hatred. Your hate of the USA and lame pidgeonholing of all it's citizens in the same bucket shows you are as deplorable as Trump and his worst supporters. Go away or back to the hole in whatever less than perfect country you emerged from.
I did not vote for him. So, yeah, I can honestly be shocked he won and honestly say, "No, I do not deserve this."

And that is about the level of the American collective IQ right there. You go out and vote for him in droves and then all act shocked that he got in. What did you think was going to happen? The reality facing you now is that you have given the most racist party in modern politics and open and blank check to implement their hateful self damaging politics. The financial ruin heading your way is everything you deserve. You are truly the most unevolved country in the developed world. Enjoy your new role as world Pariahs, you deserve it. And sadly HE IS YOUR PRESIDENT
well you did your country and the rest of the a disservice by not voting against the hate that Trump was spewing. you helped to elect him by not voting for the opposition
Maybe you overrate your co-workers...
Obviously, there are mental hillbillies in NJ? And thanks for not voting.

9 out 10 women I know thru work and socially voted for Trump, This shocked me the most. I voted for neither as I will not vote just for the sake of voting in the lesser of two evils. The concensus that only uneducated hillbillies voted for Trump is False from my observations and interactions.

Senator Ben Sasse : "I will do everything in my power to hold the president to his promises" . Which promises are those, Senator ? The ones he made in a few minute's speech after the election, or those he made during the eighteen months of the presidential campaign ?
no, she won...they just manipulated the vote...how do i know...the silence in the streets today was deafening. america is stunned and sickened by this stunt.
Expected Hilary Clinton would win by landslide but wasn't to be.  Very disappointed and sad.

Because you didn't get your way? Ironic, this is how the New York Times predicted that the Right would react if Trump didn't win.  It seems to me that you are no better than the party you opposed, no?
i see no reason for a smooth transition of power.

I suggest you do your math a little better, Mike.  50M people voted for Trump.  50. A quarter of eligible voters.  Less than a sixth of the population.  To suggest that their numbers are three times as high is probably the same thinking you used to rationalize that a man who bragged about groping women is going to be remotely capable of good judgment as president.
Trump's first act will be to declare himself an autocrat. To imagine that is not where this is headed is extremely naive.

Agreed, Amanda. The man hasn't changed his stripes because he got 48% of the vote -- less of the popular vote than Hillary. What's all this nonsense about "Let's come together and give him a chance to govern?" We know what this guy is made of. Just look at his stump speeches -- racist remarks, mocking of people with disabilities, maniacal riffs playing to the lunatic fringe. Or his record of business failures, petty lawsuits, tax cheating, adultery and sexual assault. And who he's got for an inner circle, people like Christie for what? transportation secretary -- a guy who is about to be indicted?

Where are the strong Democratic leaders willing to stand up and say they will hold him accountable and oppose his crazy policies? And what about these Republicans who found him despicable but now see him as their leader and savior of the party? Please. If our elected leaders won't stand up for us, it really is time to take to the streets, like the protesters are right now outside my Chicago hotel room.
Because he is a billionaire and an oligarch. The politicians are mere puppets of the oligarchy - they wouldn't dare upset one of their masters. And Trump comes from the masters class.

How is it possible that ALL politicians are too cowardly to stand up to this man (Trump) and his supporters?  It is unbelievable, including politicians, media and anyone else. At the very least, elected officials have the duty to protect their constituents.

They want to heal their hurt at the expense of others, which is deplorable. They hope to trample over people not like them to take back their country, which is deplorable. And they are being played as fools that will be ground under the wheels of the machine they have unleashed, which is deplorable.
Am I my brother's keeper?
You're not in "the majority". Clinton won the majority of votes. Trump won more electoral college votes, which resulted in a win under our Constitution.  That's not being "out of touch".

You fought the good fight Paul, with great valor, courage and personal sacrifice.

You're never going to right all wrongs, fix all suffering, at least not until technology takes off. Even if the Democrats won all branches, we had Medicare for all, huge increases in basic scientific and medical research, in environmental efficiency standards, massive increases in Heckman-style early human development, in education, advanced infrastructure…, still most people in the world would live in terrible poverty in third world countries. You can't solve all problems as an individual, you just have to accept that, and be proud of continuing to fight to do the good you reasonably can, so at least it's a lot better than it would have been. So many people doing that is what has advanced us so much since the beginning of this country, and since the Age of Enlightenment.

That's exactly right, ArtB. Which other Republican candidate would have caused such fear and outrage in this country today? It's not because he's a conservative. It's because he's terrifying and dangerous for our country.

The worst part is that he will not be able to really improve his constituents' lives, so to keep them happy, he will have to throw them the red meat of racism, xenophobia and misogyny that got him elected. So much easier than actually providing them with stable, good-paying jobs, healthcare, decent schools and a successful foreign policy. God help us!

Ben
That is assuming these people stop watching Fox News. Trump can do all of those thing but it will be Obama and Hillary's fault. They know not of the destruction they bring to themselves and I fear they will always blame the other.
@Will.i.am:  Facts don't matter to Ryan; he is just a mindless party apparatchik.
The same way GWB did, with a swagger.  Telling lies, and acting on them is the politician's stock in trade.  That particular lie has sticking power.  It worked for Bush.
Paul Ryan demonstrates once again that he is a lightweight.  How does he defend saying that Donald Trump has a mandate for his policies (?), given that he apparently did not win the popular vote?
